answer: Sure, here is the answer: Sir Isaac Newton's Theory is the foundational theory in physics. Its primary contribution is the mathematical description of motion and gravitation. This theory revolutionized the scientific understanding of the universe and laid the groundwork for modern-day physics. It is divided into two main pillars of scientific understanding: Motion and Equilibrium: This pillar covered the concepts of inertia, motion, acceleration, velocity, and equilibrium.
